data.title: Cardinals Schedule, Homestand Highlights, Promotions
data.meta_description: Cardinals Schedule: When do the Cardinals Play? Where is this week's game? Get the latest Regular Season Cardinals Schedule here.
data.text:
**Scroll down for theme tickets, promotional schedule, ticket packs and other items of interest.

**Scroll down for 2025 Cardinals Schedule and 2025 Cardinals SPRING TRAINING SCHEDULE.

POCKET SCHEDULES:

Email us your name and mailing address and we will mail you a “pocket schedule” like the one below.

Promotions

The St. Louis Cardinals 2024 promotional schedule with over 35 giveaways for ticketed fans at cardinals.com/promotions.

Below is a list of the 2024 promotional schedule. In addition to the robust promotional giveaway schedule, a 2024 Theme Ticket schedule will be announced at a later date. More promotional dates and item photographs will be posted at cardinals.com/promotions as they become available.

HOMESTAND HIGHLIGHTS

The Cardinals are back at Busch Stadium to open a six-game homestand starting with a three-game weekend series against the Los Angeles Dodgers (August 16-18) followed by three games with the Milwaukee Brewers (August 20-22). Fans can view a full list of homestand highlights at cardinals.com/homestand.

Friday, August 16 — Cardinals vs. Los Angeles Dodgers (7:15 PM)

Probable Pitchers: RHP Miles Mikolas (8-9, 5.30) vs. TBA

TV: Bally Sports Midwest, MLB Network (out-of-market only)

Radio: KMOX 1120 AM, 98.7 FM & WIJR 880 AM (Spanish)

Gates: 5:15 PM

Adult “Turn Ahead the Clock” Cardinals Jersey Giveaway: 25,000 fans, ages 16 and older.

Boy Band Night: With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will take home a Boy Band-inspired Cardinals tee. Come early to jam with DJ Chris Brown in the Budweiser Terrace before the game. To purchase tickets, visit cardinals.com/boyband.

City Connect: Players will wear the team’s new Nike City Connect uniform for the ninth time this year. Visit cardinals.com/CityConnect for more information.

Honorary First Pitch: Olympic gold medalist and St. Louis area native Jackie Joyner-Kersee will throw out a ceremonial first pitch before tonight’s game.

Flashback Friday & Artifact Spotlight: Before every Friday home game, the Cardinals Museum hosts two presentations in the Sportsman’s Park Theater, one highlighting artifacts in the museum’s collection not currently on display at 4:00 PM and another featuring intimate and candid interviews with former Cardinals alumni and personnel at 4:30 PM. Today’s interview will be with former Cardinals relief pitcher Ray King. To purchase museum tickets, visit cardinals.com/museum.

Weekend-Long 50/50 Raffle: This weekend’s 50/50 Raffle drawing, presented by DraftKings at Casino Queen, will take place on Sunday, August 18th, at the end of the 7th inning. Fans must be 18 years of age or older and be located in the state of Missouri at the time of purchase. To purchase tickets, visit cardinals.com/5050.

Cardinals Care Silent Auctions: Autographed items from Cardinals players, coaches and alumni can be bid on each home series by fans in the ballpark and at home via cardinals.com/ccauctions. This series’ auction items will be on display tonight inside the CommunityAmerica Cardinals Club, UMB Champions Club, and Redbird Club. The auction will run through Sunday, August 18th at 9:00 PM.

MLBPAA Auctions: The MLB Players Alumni Association will conduct a silent auction by Gate 1 and Gate 3 through the fifth inning. Proceeds will benefit Cardinals Care and MLBPAA.

Saturday, August 17 — Cardinals vs. Los Angeles Dodgers (6:15 PM)

Probable Pitchers: RHP Andre Pallante (4-6, 4.21) vs. RHP Tyler Glasnow (9-6, 3.49)

TV: FOX

Radio: KMOX 1120 AM, 98.7 FM & WIJR 880 AM (Spanish)

Gates: 4:15 PM

Scott Rolen Bobblehead Giveaway: 25,000 fans, ages 16 and older, presented by Ameren.

City Connect: Players will wear the team’s new Nike City Connect uniform for the tenth time this year. Visit cardinals.com/CityConnect for more information.

Saturday Signings at the Museum: Former Cardinals relief pitcher Ray King will sign from 2–4 PM with museum admission. Visit cardinals.com/museum for more information.

Weekend-Long 50/50 Raffle: This weekend’s 50/50 Raffle drawing, presented by DraftKings at Casino Queen, will take place on Sunday, August 18th, at the end of the 7th inning. Fans must be 18 years of age or older and be located in the state of Missouri at the time of purchase. To purchase tickets, visit cardinals.com/5050.

MLBPAA Auctions: The MLB Players Alumni Association will conduct a silent auction by Gate 1, Gate 3 and inside CommunityAmerica Cardinals Club and Redbird Club through the fifth inning. Proceeds will benefit Cardinals Care and MLBPAA.

Sunday, August 18 — Cardinals vs. Los Angeles Dodgers (1:15 PM)

Probable Pitchers: RHP Sonny Gray (11-7, 3.93) vs. LHP Clayton Kershaw (1-2, 3.50)

TV: Bally Sports Midwest

Radio: KMOX 1120 AM, 98.7 FM & WIJR 880 AM (Spanish)

Gates: 11:15 AM

Cardinals Belt Bag Giveaway: 25,000 fans, ages 16 and older, presented by Phillips 66.

Honorary First Pitches: 2024 NBA/Stanley Cup Champions, former high school classmates and St. Louis natives Jayson Tatum and Matthew Tkachuk will throw out a pair of ceremonial first pitches before today’s game.

Prairie Farms Ice Cream Sunday: Starting two hours prior to the game, fans and families can enjoy games, prizes and free North Star frozen treats in Ford Plaza (while supplies last).

Weekend-Long 50/50 Raffle: This weekend’s 50/50 Raffle drawing, presented by DraftKings at Casino Queen, will take place today at the end of the 7th inning. Fans must be 18 years of age or older and be located in the state of Missouri at the time of purchase. To purchase tickets, visit cardinals.com/5050.

Cardinals Care Silent Auctions: Autographed items from Cardinals players, coaches and alumni can be bid on each home series by fans at cardinals.com/ccauctions. This series’ auction will conclude tonight at 9:00 PM.

MLBPAA Auctions: The MLB Players Alumni Association will conduct a silent auction by Gate 1, Gate 3 and inside CommunityAmerica Cardinals Club and Redbird Club through the fifth inning. Proceeds will benefit Cardinals Care and MLBPAA.

Tuesday, August 20 — Cardinals vs. Milwaukee Brewers (6:45 PM)

Probable Pitchers: RHP Erick Fedde (8-6, 3.40) vs. RHP Frankie Montas (5-8, 4.86)

TV: Bally Sports Midwest

Radio: KMOX 1120 AM, 98.7 FM & WIJR 880 AM (Spanish)

Gates: 5:15 PM

Woody Williams Budweiser Bash: With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will take home a limited-edition bobblehead of Woody Williams. VIP ticket-holders will also have access to a pregame autograph session with Woody in Budweiser Terrace. To purchase tickets, visit cardinals.com/budbash.

Boots at Busch: 93.7 The Bull and the Cardinals welcome back the Boots at Busch concert series. Dustin Coleman and The Magnificent Mullets will perform in Budweiser Terrace beginning at 5:20 PM. Tickets are available for a special price of $9.37 at cardinals.com/bootsatbusch.

Marmol’s MVP’s: Oli Marmol with host a group from Families United for tonight’s game as part of his Marol’s MVP’s ticket program.

Cardinals Care Silent Auctions: Autographed items from Cardinals players, coaches and alumni can be bid on each home series by fans in the ballpark and at home via cardinals.com/ccauctions. This series’ auction items will be on display today inside the CommunityAmerica Cardinals Club, UMB Champions Club and Redbird Club. The auction will run through Thursday, August 22 at 9:00 PM.

Wednesday, August 21 — Cardinals vs. Milwaukee Brewers (6:45 PM)

Probable Pitchers: RHP Kyle Gibson (7-5, 4.26) vs. RHP Tobias Myers

TV: Bally Sports Midwest, FS1

Radio: KMOX 1120 AM, 98.7 FM & WIJR 880 AM (Spanish)

Gates: 5:15 PM

Friends Night: With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will take home a Friends-themed Cardinals bobblehead featuring Fredbird and Paul Goldschmidt. A portion of each ticket sold will be donated to the Matthew Perry Foundation. To purchase tickets, visit cardinals.com/friends.

Battle at Busch: 105.7 The Point and the Cardinals welcome back the Battle at Busch concert series. Today’s battle features The Downbads, E.P.I Q. and Send The Message. Specially-priced tickets available for $10.57. Performances begin at 5:00 PM in Budweiser Terrace. Purchase tickets or learn more at cardinals.com/battleatbusch.

Kyle’s Krew: Kyle Gibson will host a group from Without Limit Dance Company for tonight’s game as part of his Kyle’s Krew player ticket program.

Thursday, August 22 — Cardinals vs. Milwaukee Brewers (1:15 PM)

Probable Pitchers: RHP Miles Mikolas vs RHP Aaron Civale

TV: Bally Sports Midwest

Radio: KMOX 1120 AM, 98.7 FM & WIJR 880 AM (Spanish)

Gates: 11:45 AM

Cardinals Care Silent Auctions: Autographed items from Cardinals players, coaches and alumni can be bid on each home series by fans at cardinals.com/ccauctions. This series’ auction will conclude tonight at 9:00 PM.

OFFICIAL 2024 CARDINALS YEARBOOK—ON SALE NOW

Close your eyes, take a breath, and think back to the best day of your career. Remember that feeling? Now, mix in the Birds on the Bat and a group of the most beloved personalities in franchise history.

Those are the types of stories we’ve brought together in the 2024 Cardinals Yearbook, where Redbirds from different eras share their greatest day as a Cardinal. The result is our newest collectible piece of Cardinals history, allowing fans to walk alongside franchise legends like David Freese (did he pick Game 6?), Ozzie Smith, Al Hrabosky, Ted Simmons, Adam Wainwright and more with every turn of the page as each recalls his best day as a Cardinal.

Order the 2024 Cardinals Yearbook today and learn more by visiting cardinals.com/yearbook.

PROMOTIONAL TICKETS AT A GLANCE: (SCROLL DOWN FOR THEME NIGHTS, ALL-INCLUSIVE)

Friends Night

Wednesday, August 21 vs. Milwaukee Brewers – 6:45 PM

Cards fans—could we BE any more excited for Friends Night on Wednesday, August 21? With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will take home their very own Friends bobblehead. Leave your smelly cats at home and be prepared to learn the art of Unagi. A portion of each ticket sold will be donated to the Matthew Perry Foundation.

Golf Night

Presented by Ascension Charity Classic

Tuesday, August 27 vs. San Diego Padres – 6:45 PM

Tee ’em up! It’s Golf Night at Busch Stadium, presented by the Ascension Charity Classic on Tuesday, August 27. With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will take home an exclusive golf-themed Cardinals rope cap. A portion of each ticket will be donated to the Ascension Charity Classic

Billikens Night

Presented by Bally Sports Midwest

Wednesday, August 28 vs. San Diego Padres – 6:45 PM

On Wednesday, August 28, cheer on the Cardinals with fellow Billikens alumni and fans on Billikens Night. With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will receive a Billikens-themed Cardinals 40 oz. tumbler. Go Bills

St. Louis Blues Night

Friday, September 6 vs. Seattle Mariners – 7:15 PM

Presented by Bally Sports Midwest

LGB! Kick off the St. Louis Blues 2024-2025 season on Friday, September 6th as the Redbirds take on the Mariners! With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will receive a Cardinals and Blues-themed full-zip jacket. Come early for a pre-game pep rally at the Budweiser Terrace!

Fiesta Cardenales

Presented by He Gets Us

Sunday, September 8 vs. Seattle Mariners – 1:15 PM

Don’t miss Fiesta Cardenales on Sunday, September 8, at Busch Stadium! The Cardinals welcome all members of the Latino and Hispanic community for a cultural celebration. With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will receive a Los Cardenales jersey designed by a local artist. Plus, a portion of each ticket sold will benefit the Hispanic Education Cultural & Scholarship Foundation. Come early for a pregame heritage event in the Budweiser Terrace!

First Responders Appreciation Night

Presented by SERVPRO

Wednesday, September 11 vs. Cincinnati Reds – 6:45 PM

The Cardinals are excited to celebrate the men and women of St. Louis that help keep our city safe – our law enforcement officers, firefighters, and emergency services personnel! First Responders Night is Wednesday, September 11! With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will receive a Cardinals Challenge Coin. And as a special thanks to our hometown heroes, you will receive a coupon for one complimentary drink! A portion of each ticket sold will be donated to The Backstoppers.

Halfway to St. Patrick’s Day

Tuesday, September 17 vs. Pittsburgh Pirates – 6:45 PM

The St. Louis Cardinals will have the Luck of the Irish on Tuesday, September 17, as they take on the Pirates! Join us for Halfway to St. Patrick’s Day at Busch Stadium and receive a Cardinals green Shamrock jersey with the purchase of a special Theme Ticket. Don’t miss a pregame performance by Falling Fences on the Budweiser Stage!

DC™Super-Villain Night

Wednesday, September 18 vs. Pittsburgh Pirates – 6:45 PM

The Joker, Harley Quinn, and The Penguin…Prepare to unleash your mischievous side. Don’t miss DC™ Super-Villain Night on Wednesday, September 18! Fans who purchase a special Theme Ticket will receive an exclusive DC™/Cardinals Joker bobblehead.

90s Night

Friday, September 20 vs. Cleveland Guardians – 7:15 PM

If you owned a Tamagotchi, watched Big Mac’s home run chase, or remember the sweet sound of dial up internet, you won’t want to miss 90s Night at Busch Stadium on Friday, September 20. With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will take home a 90s style Cardinals windbreaker jacket. Plus, jam to 90s hits during a pregame concert by Proud Larry!

Party Suites

Fans interested in entertaining groups at Busch Stadium for 2024 games may purchase Party Suite tickets beginning Wednesday, November 15, at 10 AM CT. More information can be found at cardinals.com/suites.

Cardinals Gift Cards

Cardinals Gift Cards can also be purchased for any dollar denomination (minimum $25), and make great holiday gifts that can be used to purchase regular season tickets, merchandise or concessions at Busch Stadium and Cardinals Nation Restaurant. Gift Cards information and purchases can be found at cardinals.com/giftcard.

2024 Promo Schedule

The Cardinals will release its 2024 promotional giveaway schedule later this week, prior to the Red Friday on-sale.

Fans can find more information and make their Red Friday ticket purchases at cardinals.com/redfriday. Tickets can also be ordered via phone at 314-345-9000 or at the Busch Stadium Ticket Windows on 8th Street. .

2024 THEME TICKET SCHEDULE

Friends Night

Wednesday, August 21 vs. Milwaukee Brewers – 6:45 PM

Cards fans—Could we BE any more excited for Friends Night on Wednesday, August 21? With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will take home their very own Friends bobblehead. Leave your smelly cats at home and be prepared to learn the art of Unagi. A portion of each ticket sold will be donated to the Matthew Perry Foundation.

St. Louis Blues Night

Friday, September 6 vs. Seattle Mariners – 7:15 PM

Presented by Bally Sports Midwest

LGB! Kick off the St. Louis Blues 2024-2025 season on Friday, September 6th as the Redbirds take on the Mariners! With the purchase of a special Theme Ticket, fans will receive a Cardinals and Blues-themed full-zip jacket. Come early for a pre-game pep rally at the Budweiser Terrace!

Halfway to St. Patrick’s Day

Tuesday, September 17 vs. Pittsburgh Pirates – 6:45 PM
